title: Introduction to PulmoDataSets
text: PulmoDataSets package offers thematically rich diverse collection datasets focused lungs, respiratory system, associated diseases. includes data related chronic respiratory conditions asthma, chronic bronchitis, COPD, well infectious diseases like tuberculosis, pneumonia, influenza, whooping cough. addition, provides datasets risk factors interventions, including smoking habits nicotine replacement therapies, critical understanding epidemiology prevention respiratory illnesses.

title: Introduction to PulmoDataSets
text: dataset PulmoDataSets package uses suffix denote type R object: _df: data frame _dt: data table _tbl_df: tibble _ts: time series selected example datasets included PulmoDataSets package: bronchitis_Cardiff_df: Chronic Bronchitis Cardiff Men. smoking_UK_tbl_df: UK Smoking Habits. nicotine_gum_df: Nicotine Gum Smoking Cessation.

previous_headings: Introduction > Data Visualization with PulmoDataSets Data
title: Introduction to PulmoDataSets
code: # Summary with .groups = "drop" to avoid the message (stored but not printed) summary_stats <- bronchitis_Cardiff_df %>%   group_by(r, rfac) %>%   summarise(     mean_cig = mean(cig, na.rm = TRUE),     mean_poll = mean(poll, na.rm = TRUE),     count = n(),     .groups = "drop"   )  # Plot only ggplot(bronchitis_Cardiff_df, aes(x = cig, y = poll, color = factor(r))) +   geom_point() +   labs(     title = "Cigarette Consumption vs Pollution",     x = "Cigarette Consumption",     y = "Pollution Level",     color = "Bronchitis"   ) +   theme_minimal()

previous_headings: Introduction > Data Visualization with PulmoDataSets Data
title: Introduction to PulmoDataSets
code: smoking_summary <- smoking_UK_tbl_df %>%   group_by(gender, smoke) %>%   summarise(avg_amt_weekends = mean(amt_weekends, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop") %>%   filter(!is.na(avg_amt_weekends))  ggplot(smoking_summary, aes(x = gender, y = avg_amt_weekends, fill = smoke)) +   geom_col(position = "dodge") +   labs(     title = "Average Weekend Smoking by Gender and Smoking Status",     x = "Gender",     y = "Average Cigarettes on Weekends",     fill = "Smoke Status"   ) +   theme_minimal()

previous_headings: Introduction > Data Visualization with PulmoDataSets Data
title: Introduction to PulmoDataSets
code: # Step 1: Calculate mean success rates (no extra packages) nicotine_summary <- nicotine_gum_df %>%   summarize(     treatment = sum(qt) / sum(tt),  # Overall success rate (treatment)     control = sum(qc) / sum(tc)      # Overall success rate (control)   )  # Step 2: Plot (manually reshape data without tidyr) ggplot(data.frame(   group = c("Treatment", "Control"),   success_rate = c(nicotine_summary$treatment, nicotine_summary$control) ), aes(group, success_rate, fill = group)) +   geom_col(width = 0.5) +   labs(     title = "Nicotine Gum vs. Control (Overall Success Rate)",     y = "Success Rate",     x = ""   ) +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("Treatment" = "#1f77b4", "Control" = "#d62728")) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(legend.position = "none")

title: Introduction to PulmoDataSets
text: PulmoDataSets package delivers ready--use respiratory datasets (COPD, asthma, TB, pneumonia, etc.) clinical epidemiological research. package simplifies data access modeling, teaching, public health studies. detailed information full documentation dataset, please refer reference manual help files included within package.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Renzo Caceres Rossi. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Caceres Rossi R (2025). PulmoDataSets: Curated Collection Pulmonary Respiratory Disease Datasets. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/lightbluetitan/pulmodatasets.
code: @Manual{,   title = {PulmoDataSets: A Curated Collection of Pulmonary and Respiratory Disease Datasets},   author = {Renzo {Caceres Rossi}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/lightbluetitan/pulmodatasets}, }

title: A Curated Collection of Pulmonary and Respiratory Disease Datasets

title: A Curated Collection of Pulmonary and Respiratory Disease Datasets
code: # Load the package  library(PulmoDataSets)  # List all datasets in the package  view_datasets_pulmo()  # Load dataset  data(nicotine_gum_df)  # Preview the dataset  head(nicotine_gum_df)  # Open in Viewer  View(nicotine_gum_df)

title: Air Pollution and Mortality — air_polution_mortality_df
text: dataset, air_polution_mortality_df, data frame containing information early study exploring relationship air pollution mortality across 5 Standard Metropolitan Statistical Areas U.S. 1959 1961.

title: Air Pollution and Mortality — air_polution_mortality_df
text: data frame 60 observations 7 variables: City Metropolitan area (factor 60 levels) Mort Mortality rate (numeric vector) Precip Annual precipitation inches (integer vector) Educ Median years education (numeric vector) NonWhite Percentage non-white population (numeric vector) NOX Nitrogen oxide concentration (integer vector) SO2 Sulfur dioxide concentration (integer vector)

title: Air Pollution and Mortality — air_polution_mortality_df
text: Data taken Sleuth3 package version 1.0-6

title: Air Pollution and Mortality — air_polution_mortality_df
text: dataset name kept 'air_polution_mortality_df' avoid confusion datasets R ecosystem. naming convention helps distinguish dataset part PulmoDataSets package assists users identifying specific characteristics. suffix 'df' indicates dataset data frame. original content modified way.
